content.question: Which of the following series can be shown to converge by using the ratio test?

choices.label: <math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity of, the fraction with numerator the square root of n, and denominator n plus 10, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity of, the fraction with numerator n to the tenth power, and denominator 10 to the n power, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity of, the fraction with numerator the natural log of n, and denominator n squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>n</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity of, the fraction with numerator n plus 1, and denominator n to the fourth power, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity of, the fraction with numerator n to the tenth power, and denominator 10 to the n power, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
